page.content: Some{jobs}still have to be done by {hand,}particularly{tying and } {stringing.}Though autumn planting is machine operated with an apple tree planter from Bulmers, because after the harvest there are no strings to obstruct the machine. { Hops grow to 16-18 ft, 1,600 plants {to the acre,}and the total number of rows at Brierley stretches{227 {miles.}The plants are prone to fungal diseases and have to be sprayed regularly. There are many types of hops and research continues to find strains that are disease resistant. The types grown at Brierley are{Omega, {Challenger, Zenith, Northdown}and {Northern Brewer. In 1984 242 tonnes of hops were harvested, selling at Â£4,400 per tonne. All the hops went for beer, the only customer being Allied Breweries.
